condition.narrative: Grant Agreement, Schedule 2, Section I.D. 2(a): Within three (3) months from the date on which this Agreement is declaredeffective, the Recipient shall update the Program Operational Manual (POM) in accordance with terms of reference acceptable to theWorld Bank and adopt the updated POM.

Grant Agreement, Schedule 2, Section III.B. (a): the Recipient shall vest in the Office of the Auditor General the responsibilityof undertaking the verification of compliance of the DLIs/DLRs, which are set forth in the table in Section IV.A.2.

Grant Agreement, Schedule 2, Section III.B. (b): the Recipient shall cause the Office of the Auditor General (“OAG”) to, not laterthan thirty (30) days after the verification of compliance of said DLIs/DLRs has been completed, prepare and furnish to theRecipient and the World Bank, a report on the results of said verification of compliance process of such scope and in such detailas the World Bank shall reasonably request.

LA, Schedule 2, Section I.D. 2(a), Without limitation on the generality of Part A of Section I of the FA, the Recipient shallprepare, in form and substance satisfactory to the Association and no later than three (3) months after the Effective Date, anoperational manual containing detailed institutional, administrative, financial, environmental and social, technical andoperational guidelines and procedures for the implementation of the Program, including a description of the PSTA4 and the roles andresponsibilities of each of the Program Implementing Entities, and thereafter, carry out the Program and cause the ProgramImplementing Entities to carry out the Program, in accordance with such operational manual, as shall have been approved by theAssociation (“Program Operational Manual”).

LA, Schedule 2, Section III.B.(a). The Recipient shall vest in the Office of the Auditor General the responsibility of undertakingthe verification of compliance of the DLIs/DLRs, which are set forth in the table in Section IV.A.2.

LA, Schedule 2, Section III.B.(b).The Recipient shall cause the Office of the Auditor General (“OAG”) to, not later than thirty(30) days, after the verification of compliance of said DLIs/DLRs has been completed, prepare and furnish to the Recipient and theAssociation, a report on the results of said verification of compliance process of such scope and in such detail as the Associationshall reasonably request.

title.narrative: New irrigation area identified, developed and/or managed where commercial viability has been a determining appraisal criterion.
New terracing area identified, developed and/or managed where commercial viability has been a determining appraisal criterion.
Improved analytical and policy reform competencies demonstrated.

target.value: Agricultural input subsidy schemes reviewed, alternative models for increasing efficiency assessed, reforms agreed and implemented

actual.value: Implementation of the PSLS is ongoing. MINAGRI's 2019/2020 Annual Report on Public-Private Investment in Agriculture has beenpublished. Preparation of an Agricultural Input Subsidy Review and Reform package is underway. An inception report is available.

title.narrative: Improvements in the Enabling Business of Agriculture (EBA) Scores
Annual increase of earmarked transfers from MINAGRI to local government.
Number of different models of service delivery contracts signed and pilot under implementation.
Number of Productive Alliances under implementation.
Number of new farm households participating in outgrower schemes has increased.
Number of farm households reached by private advisory services (non-outgrower schemes) has increased.
Volume of private sector investment (in US$) matching public financing in PPP infrastructure projects.
Private investment in agriculture value chain services (US$)
Share of small scale farmers using improved seeds.
Digital information platforms designed and operational.

target.value: The Livestock registration application (holding cow data with national coverage) will be interfaced with MIS, ALIS I and II, Farmerregistration application in the common data warehouse platform Sector Performance Dash Board is in place and publicly accessibleonline, whereby it provides reports on national agricultural macro indicators, national Indicator of Food Security and PSTA 4results indicators

actual.value: Development of a common data warehouse (CDWH) platform is ongoing but remains behind schedule. An Extract Transform and Load (ETL)pipeline to pull data from the Land Information System into the CDWH has been successfully implemented and land dataset iscurrentlyavailable. However, there are no user requirements for business intelligence reports and the data quality is still anissue due to a lack of metadata. A livestock registration application to house national cattle data has been developed andavailable livestock dataset has been pulled into the CDWH. However the data quality is poor. Countrywide cattle data collection isongoing. The project team with TA from the Bank is working to resolve the data quality issues.

title.narrative: Mechanism to strengthen Agriculture Public-Private Dialogues and Agriculture Value Chain Platforms designed and implemented.

target.value: Additional 2 Agriculture PPDs heldAgriculture VC platforms are fully functional and yielded evidence of satisfactory results (asper M&E of operating plan

actual.value: Year 1 and 2 deliverables have been met. Two agriculture Public-Private Dialogues have been conducted. Six VCPs have beenestablished (Potato, Horticulture, Coffee, Tea, Maize, and Onion), have operating plans, are functional and are reported to beyielding satisfactory results. In year 3, two new PPDs included (i) one that was carried out in Western Province and focused amongothers on identifying policy gaps and other challenges hindering the development of the agribusiness sector in the Province, and(ii) a second one that was carried out at the national level and discussed key priorities issues to consider during the 2021/2022fiscal year.The monitoring and evaluation of the VCPs operating plans and the satisfaction survey results provided evidence thatthe six VCPs (maize, coffee, horticulture, tea, onion and potato) already established are fully functional and have yieldedsatisfactory results.

title.narrative: Organizational Development plan successfully prepared and implementation on track.

target.value: Upgrade of HR management function completed

actual.value: Year 1: The Organizational Review was completed.Year 2: An Organizational Development Plan was prepared and approved. The upgradeof the HR management function has been completed. Ernst & Young has been hired to prepare the performance report on the HRManagement function. An inception report is available.

title.narrative: Performance of MINAGRI and RAB in achieving the milestones established in their respective Organizational Development or Restructuring implementation plan

target.value: Unqualified audit opinion on financial statement of RAB

actual.value: The year 1 deliverable was met. Implementation of the RAB reforms is ongoing. RAB Management has not yet shared a monitoring reportof the implementation status of the OAG audit recommendations. The year 2 deliverable has not yet been met; the actual deviationwas -22 percent.

title.narrative: Business leader’s perceptions about agricultural investment climate in Rwanda.

actual.value: The survey has been completed. The World Bank is waiting for the associated report from MINAGRI.

title.narrative: Number of Productive Alliances under implementation in Livestock Value Chain.
Number of Productive Alliances under implementation high value crops Value Chain.
Improvement in functional performance of interagency coordination mechanisms.

actual.value: Stakeholder Perception surveys of the ASWG, JSR, and Joint Imihigos have been conducted.
